newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Chronology of Roh Tae-woo, Chun Doo Hwan trials.
newsitem.headline: Chronology of Roh Tae-woo, Chun Doo Hwan trials.

text.p: South Korea's Supreme Court on Thursday rebuffed prosecution appeals for harsher sentences against former presidents Chun Doo Hwan and Roh Tae-woo over a 1979 coup and an army massacre a year later.

It upheld a lower court's decision in December to commute Chun's death sentence to life in jail and Roh's 22-1/2 year jail term to 17 years in connection with Chun's seizing power and the massacre in the city of Kwangju.
The following is a chronology of major events leading up to South Korea's "trial of the century".
Oct 19, 1995 - Opposition lawmaker claims Roh amassed 400 billion won ($447 million) while in office from 1988-93.
Oct 27 - Roh tearfully confesses building a 500 billion won-slush fund.
Nov 1 - Prosecutors grill Roh, the first South Korean president -- serving or retired -- to face legal questions.
Nov 16 - Roh is arrested and held on charges of taking bribes from businessmen.
Nov 24 - President Kim Young-sam orders his ruling party to draft a special law to punish his two predecessors.
Nov 30 - Prosecutors reopen the probe into a 1979 coup and the 1980 army massacre of pro-democracy protesters in Kwangju.
Dec 1 - Chun rejects a prosecution summons to appear for questioning and the following day heads for his hometown after accusing President Kim of a political witchhunt.
Dec 3 - Chun is arrested on charges of leading the 1979 coup and is brought to Seoul. He begins a hunger strike in jail.
Dec 5 - Roh is charged with accepting bribes. Prosecutors also indict nine leading business executives.
Dec 9 - Seoul prosecutors probe Chun's slush fund.
Dec 18 - Roh, nine top business leaders and five former aides go on trial for corruption.
Dec 21 - Chun and Roh are formally indicted on mutiny charges for their roles in the 1979 coup.
Jan 12, 1996 - Chun is charged with accepting bribes.
Jan 22 - Prosecutors indict Chun and Roh on treason charges over the Kwangju massacre.
Feb 26 - Chun appears in court to answer bribery charges.
Feb 28 - Prosecutors wind up a three-month probe into the coup and the army massacre.
March 11 - Hearing begins on mutiny and treason charges against Chun, Roh and 14 former generals.
Aug 5 - Prosecutors demand death for Chun, life for Roh and prison terms of 10 years to life for the 14 former generals.
Aug 26 - Seoul District Criminal Court sentences Chun to death and Roh to 22-1/2 years in prison.
Aug 31 - Chun and Roh appeal. Later prosecutors seek heavier penalties.
Oct 7 - Appeal hearing begins.
Dec 16 - An appeals court commutes Chun's death sentence to life imprisonment and cuts the jail term of Roh to 17 years.
Dec 23 - Chun and Roh drop their appeals.
Dec 23 - Prosecutors appeal to the Supreme Court for heavier sentences against Chun and Roh.
April 17, 1997 - The Supreme Court rejects the prosecution's appeal against the reduced sentences for Chun and Roh and upholds the appeals court ruling.
